title: 1 Thessalonians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 1 Thessalonians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 5 chapters.

questions.question: Who were the three individuals that wrote the letter to the church of the Thessalonians?
questions.explanation: The letter begins with Paul, Silvanus, and Timotheus addressing the Thessalonian church.

questions.question: What three qualities of the Thessalonians' faith does Paul mention in 1 Thessalonians 1:3?
options: Work of faith, labor of love, patience of hope
questions.correctAnswer: Work of faith, labor of love, patience of hope
questions.explanation: Paul specifically praises their work of faith, labor of love, and patience of hope in the Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 1:9, from what did the Thessalonians turn to serve the living and true God?
questions.explanation: They turned from idols to serve the living and true God.

questions.question: In 1 Thessalonians 2:2, where had Paul and his companions been shamefully entreated?
questions.explanation: Paul refers to their sufferings and shameful treatment at Philippi.

questions.question: What metaphor does Paul use in 1 Thessalonians 2:7 to describe how he and his companions cared for the Thessalonians?
options: As a nurse cherisheth her children
As a shepherd tends his sheep
As a father instructs his son
As a teacher guides a pupil
questions.correctAnswer: As a nurse cherisheth her children
questions.explanation: Paul compares their gentleness to that of a nurse cherishing her children.

questions.question: What reason did Paul give in 1 Thessalonians 2:9 for laboring night and day?
options: To preach the gospel without being chargeable
To earn money for the poor
questions.correctAnswer: To preach the gospel without being chargeable
questions.explanation: Paul labored so as not to be a burden while preaching the gospel.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 3:2, who was sent to establish and comfort the Thessalonians in their faith?
questions.explanation: Timotheus was sent as a brother and fellow laborer to strengthen the Thessalonians.

questions.question: What was the purpose of sending Timotheus according to 1 Thessalonians 3:3?
options: That no man should be moved by afflictions
To write a letter to Paul
questions.correctAnswer: That no man should be moved by afflictions
questions.explanation: Timotheus was sent to encourage them not to be shaken by trials.

questions.question: In 1 Thessalonians 4:3, what does Paul say is the will of God for the Thessalonians?
questions.explanation: Paul explains that God's will is for their sanctification, particularly abstaining from fornication.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 4:16, who will sound the trump of God at the Lord’s coming?
questions.explanation: The Lord descends with a shout, the voice of the archangel, and the trump of God.

questions.question: What does Paul tell the Thessalonians to do in 1 Thessalonians 5:16?
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts them to always rejoice.

questions.question: In 1 Thessalonians 5:23, Paul prays that God will preserve the Thessalonians how?
options: Blameless until the coming of the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Blameless until the coming of the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul prays for their whole spirit, soul, and body to be preserved blameless.

questions.question: Which chapter contains the teaching about the resurrection of the dead and the coming of the Lord?
questions.explanation: Chapter 4 discusses the coming of the Lord and resurrection of the dead in Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the coming of the Lord in 1 Thessalonians 5:2?
options: It comes as a thief in the night
It will be announced by all nations
It will be preceded by a famine
It will be visible to all
questions.correctAnswer: It comes as a thief in the night
questions.explanation: The day of the Lord will come unexpectedly like a thief.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 1:7, the Thessalonians became examples to all who believe in which regions?
questions.explanation: They were examples to believers in Macedonia and Achaia.

questions.question: How does Paul describe the Thessalonians' reception of the gospel in 1 Thessalonians 1:6?
options: Received the word in much affliction with joy of the Holy Ghost
Received the word only in word, not power
Received the word without any trouble
questions.correctAnswer: Received the word in much affliction with joy of the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: They accepted the gospel despite affliction and with joy.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 2:11, Paul exhorted, comforted, and charged the Thessalonians as whom?
questions.explanation: Paul compares his care to that of a father.

questions.question: In 1 Thessalonians 3:6, what tidings did Timotheus bring back to Paul?
options: Good tidings of their faith and charity
questions.correctAnswer: Good tidings of their faith and charity
questions.explanation: Timotheus brought back a report of their faith, love, and remembrance.

questions.question: In 1 Thessalonians 4:11, what does Paul instruct the Thessalonians to do?
options: Study to be quiet, do your own business, and work with your hands
questions.correctAnswer: Study to be quiet, do your own business, and work with your hands
questions.explanation: Paul urges them to live quietly and work with their hands.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 5:8, what items are to be put on as armor for the day of the Lord?
options: Breastplate of faith and love, helmet of the hope of salvation
Shield of righteousness, sword of the Spirit
Helmet of salvation, belt of truth
Breastplate of justice, shoes of peace
questions.correctAnswer: Breastplate of faith and love, helmet of the hope of salvation
questions.explanation: Paul uses these metaphors for spiritual armor.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the Thessalonians in 1 Thessalonians 5:5?
options: Ye are all the children of light and the children of the day
Ye are of the night and darkness
questions.correctAnswer: Ye are all the children of light and the children of the day
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts them with those in darkness and night.

questions.question: What instruction is given in 1 Thessalonians 5:19?
questions.explanation: Paul commands not to quench the Spirit.

questions.question: Who does Paul say will rise first at the Lord’s coming according to 1 Thessalonians 4:16?
questions.explanation: The dead in Christ will rise first at the Lord's return.

questions.question: In 1 Thessalonians 3:8, Paul says 'For now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.' What does this express?
options: Paul's joy and life depend on their faith
questions.correctAnswer: Paul's joy and life depend on their faith
questions.explanation: Paul's life is sustained by their steadfastness in the Lord.

questions.question: In 1 Thessalonians 5:12, what does Paul urge the Thessalonians to do regarding those who labor among them?
options: Know them and esteem them very highly in love
questions.correctAnswer: Know them and esteem them very highly in love
questions.explanation: Paul encourages respect and love for church leaders.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 2:14, the Thessalonians became followers of the churches in which location?
questions.explanation: They became followers of the churches of God in Judaea.

questions.question: How are believers instructed to respond to evil in 1 Thessalonians 5:15?
options: See that none render evil for evil
questions.correctAnswer: See that none render evil for evil
questions.explanation: Believers should always follow that which is good.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Thessalonians 4:13, believers should sorrow for those who sleep as others who have no hope.
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers not to sorrow as those without hope for those who have died in Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: In 1 Thessalonians 5:9, Paul says God has appointed believers to wrath.
questions.explanation: God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Thessalonians 1:5 states the gospel came not only in word but also in power and the Holy Ghost.
questions.explanation: Paul affirms the gospel came with power and the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: True or False: Paul compares the Thessalonians to children who must be chastised harshly in 1 Thessalonians 2:7.
questions.explanation: Paul compares himself to a nurse cherishing her children, showing gentleness.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Thessalonians 5:21 instructs believers to prove all things and hold fast that which is good.
questions.explanation: Believers are to test all teachings and keep what is good.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs the Thessalonians to quench the Spirit in 1 Thessalonians 5:19.
questions.explanation: Paul tells them not to quench the Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Thessalonians 4:14, if we believe Jesus died and rose again, God will also bring with Him those who sleep in Jesus.
questions.explanation: Paul assures believers of resurrection with Christ.

questions.question: True or False: Paul asks the Thessalonians to pray for him and his companions in 1 Thessalonians 5:25.
questions.explanation: Paul requests prayer for himself and his coworkers.

questions.question: True or False: In 1 Thessalonians 3:10, Paul prays night and day that he might perfect what is lacking in their faith.
questions.explanation: Paul prays earnestly for their spiritual growth.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Thessalonians 5:6 instructs believers to sleep as do others.
questions.explanation: Paul tells believers not to sleep but to watch and be sober.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For God hath not called us unto ______, but unto holiness.'
questions.explanation: God calls believers to holiness, not uncleanness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'But ye, brethren, are not in _______, that that day should overtake you as a thief.'
questions.explanation: Believers are not in darkness so the day will not surprise them.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and ______ one another, even as also ye do.'
questions.explanation: Believers are instructed to comfort and edify one another.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will ______ it.'
questions.explanation: God who calls believers is faithful to accomplish it.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 3:1, where was Paul left alone while he sent Timotheus to the Thessalonians?
questions.explanation: Paul stayed at Athens and sent Timotheus to encourage the Thessalonians.

questions.question: What is the main theme of 1 Thessalonians 5:1-11?
options: The coming of the Lord and how to live in readiness
Instructions on giving to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: The coming of the Lord and how to live in readiness
questions.explanation: This passage teaches about the unexpected coming of the Lord and calls for sober, watchful living.

questions.question: Which phrase best describes how the Thessalonians received the word of God in 1 Thessalonians 2:13?
options: As the word of God, not of men
questions.correctAnswer: As the word of God, not of men
questions.explanation: They accepted the message as God's true word, not merely human words.

questions.question: According to 1 Thessalonians 4:6, why must no man defraud his brother in any matter?
options: Because the Lord is the avenger of all such
Because it is a sin against the church
questions.correctAnswer: Because the Lord is the avenger of all such
questions.explanation: God will repay those who wrong others.
